=== Purchase Information === Product Title: The Passion of the Christ (Widescreen Edition) Review Date: 2004/10/01 Store: James Caviezel (Actor), Monica Bellucci (Actor), Mel Gibson (Director, Writer) & 0 more Rated: R Format: DVD Categories: Movies & TV, Studio Specials, 20th Century Fox Home Entertainment, All Fox Titles Average Rating: 4.8 Product Details: {'Genre': 'Drama/Religion', 'Format': 'Anamorphic, Closed-captioned, Color, AC-3, NTSC, Subtitled, DTS Surround Sound, Dolby, Widescreen', 'Contributor': 'James Caviezel, Monica Bellucci, Fabio Sartor, Mel Gibson, Toni Bertorelli, Luca Lionello, Francesco De Vito, Mattia Sbragia, Maia Morgenstern, Hristo Shopov, Christo Jivkov, Benedict Fitzgerald, Giacinto Ferro, Claudia GeriniJames Caviezel, Monica Bellucci, Fabio Sartor, Mel Gibson, Toni Bertorelli, Luca Lionello, Francesco De Vito, Mattia Sbragia, Maia Morgenstern, Hristo Shopov, Christo Jivkov, Benedict Fitzgerald, Giacinto Ferro, Claudia Gerini See more', 'Language': 'Aramaic, Hebrew, Latin', 'Runtime': '2 hours and 6 minutes'} Review Text: If you want to view an interpretation of Christ that reduces him to little more than a helpless idiot, watch this movie. If you actually respect him, avoid this film at all costs. If Christ's life prior to the crucifixion is missing, then the story is pointless. His great lessons are missing. The sermon on the mount is reduced to one line. And the most important point is missing -- CHRIST CHOSE THE CROSS. Here, he is portrayed as a victim, dragged around by the jew-mob (there isn't a character there, just a mass-mob) completely unable to do a thing. The focus isn't on Christ's message, love, pacificm, or teachings, it's a sensationalist view of his suffering, which doesn't fit well with the Christ story. Review Title: An affront to Christ Rating: 1.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Product Title: Yu-Gi-Oh! // Movie - Capsule Monsters / Part 1 [DVD] Review Date: 2006/06/08 Store: * (Actor, Director) Rated: Unrated Format: DVD Categories: Movies & TV, Science Fiction & Fantasy, Science Fiction, Animation Product Description: ['Saving the world from destruction week after week is not an easy task, so when Joey wins an exotic trip for four, Yugi and his friends decide to take a much needed vacation\x85or so they think! Before reaching their destination, their plane crash-lands in a deserted forest. Here in a remote area thousands of miles from Egypt lies a great pyramid that contains an incredible secret - a portal to another dimension! The World of the Capsule Monsters!" It\'s a battle for survival as Yugi trades in his Duel Disk for a Capsule Shooter in a life-threatening challenge that is so much more than just a game!"'] Average Rating: 4.4 Product Details: {'Genre': 'Kids & family', 'Format': 'Animated, Color, DVD, NTSC', 'Contributor': '*', 'Language': 'English, Japanese', 'Runtime': '1 hour and 35 minutes', 'Aspect Ratio': '1.33:1', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'Unrated (Not Rated)', 'Product Dimensions': '7.5 x 5.5 x 0.75 inches; 4 Ounces', 'Item model number': '1-4210-0462-3', 'Director': '*', 'Media Format': 'Animated, Color, DVD, NTSC', 'Run time': '1 hour and 35 minutes', 'Release date': 'May 23, 2006', 'Actors': '*', 'Studio': 'Funimation Prod', 'Number of discs': '1'} Review Text: This anime is amazing. The pacing is perfect. The story is perfect. The characters--well you know the characters. The puzzles are great. The only tiny thing missing was Kaiba. As much as the original series was super fantastic wonderful, this one takes it up a notch. I rented it and now I'm buying two copies. I'm floored by what a good job they did. The theatrical release has nothing on this. This is what should have been in the movies. This is good. Buy it. Watch it a dozen times. If you like Yu-Gi-Oh you will love this. Review Title: Anime Perfection Rating: 5.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Product Title: The Adventures of Sharkboy and Lavagirl in 3-D also includes 2d version [DVD] Review Date: 2012/04/27 Store: Cayden Boyd (Actor), George Lopez (Actor), Robert Rodriguez (Director) & 0 more Rated: PG Format: DVD Categories: Movies & TV, Studio Specials, Miramax Home Entertainment, All Titles Product Description: ['Another family adventure from the hit-making director of SPY KIDS(TM), THE ADVENTURES OF SHARKBOY AND LAVAGIRL is nonstop fun and stars Hollywood favorites David Arquette, Kristin Davis, and George Lopez. Everyone always knew that Max had a wild imagination ... but no one believed that his wildest creations -- a boy raised by watchful great white sharks and a girl with the force of a volcano -- were real! Now, these two pint-sized action masters will show Max that even an ordinary kid has what it takes to be extraordinary! Bursting with cool, eye-popping 3-D special effects -- even the smallest dreamers can become the biggest heroes in this entertaining motion picture!'] Average Rating: 4.6 Product Details: {'Genre': 'Action & Adventure', 'Format': 'Closed-captioned, AC-3, Color, Dolby, DVD, NTSC, Subtitled, 3D, Widescreen', 'Contributor': 'Tiger Darrow, David Arquette, Taylor Dooley, Rico Torres, Shane Graham, Cayden Boyd, Marc Musso, Jacob Davich, Sasha Pieterse, Taylor Lautner, Kristin Davis, George Lopez, Robert RodriguezTiger Darrow, David Arquette, Taylor Dooley, Rico Torres, Shane Graham, Cayden Boyd, Marc Musso, Jacob Davich, Sasha Pieterse, Taylor Lautner, Kristin Davis, George Lopez, Robert Rodriguez See more', 'Language': 'English (Dolby Digital 5.1), Unqualified', 'Runtime': '1 hour and 33 minutes', 'Aspect Ratio': '1.85:1', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'PG (Parental Guidance Suggested)', 'Product Dimensions': '7.5 x 5.5 x 0.5 inches; 2.4 Ounces', 'Director': 'Robert Rodriguez', 'Media Format': 'Closed-captioned, AC-3, Color, Dolby, DVD, NTSC, Subtitled, 3D, Widescreen', 'Run time': '1 hour and 33 minutes', 'Release date': 'September 20, 2005', 'Actors': 'Cayden Boyd, George Lopez, Kristin Davis, David Arquette, Taylor Lautner', 'Subtitles': 'Spanish', 'Studio': 'Dimension', 'Number of discs': '2'} Review Text: The product description very clearly states this product comes with four pair of the type of 3D glasses you need to view this movie (the red/blue kind). I figured they would package in four very cheap pair of cardboard glasses. There were no glasses at all.

The movie is fun, but buy it from someone else. There are other, better, sellers here on Amazon. Review Title: No Glases Rating: 1.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Product Title: How to Train Your Dragon Review Date: 2012/05/24 Store: Jay Baruchel (Actor), Gerard Butler (Actor), Chris Sanders (Director, Writer), Dean DeBlois (Director, Writer) & 1 more Rated: PG Format: DVD Categories: Movies & TV, Studio Specials, DreamWorks Product Description: ['A winner with audiences and critics alike, the Academy Award-Nominated DreamWorks Animation film, How to Train Your Dragon, rolls fire-breathing action, epic adventure and laughs into a captivating and original story. Hiccup is a young Viking who defies tradition when he befriends one of his deadliest foes — a ferocious dragon he calls Toothless. Together, the unlikely heroes must fight against all odds to save both their worlds in this "wonderful good-time hit!" (Gene Shalit, Today)Bonus Content:', 'Viking-Sized Cast', 'Viking-Sized Cast', 'The Technical Artistry of Dragon', 'The Technical Artistry of Dragon', "Filmmakers' Commentary", "Filmmakers' Commentary", 'Keep Out!', 'Keep Out!'] Average Rating: 4.8 Product Details: {'Aspect Ratio': '2.35:1', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'PG (Parental Guidance Suggested)', 'Product Dimensions': '6.5 x 5.25 x 0.25 inches; 3.2 Ounces', 'Item model number': '0988409821', 'Director': 'Chris Sanders, Dean DeBlois', 'Media Format': 'AC-3, Animated, Color, Dolby, Dubbed, NTSC, Subtitled, Widescreen, 3D', 'Run time': '1 hour and 38 minutes', 'Release date': 'February 1, 2018', 'Actors': 'Jay Baruchel, Gerard Butler, Craig Ferguson, America Ferrera, Jonah Hill', 'Dubbed': 'English, French, Spanish, Portuguese', 'Subtitles': 'English, French, Spanish, Portuguese', 'Producers': 'Bonnie Arnold', 'Language': 'English (Dolby Digital 5.1), Portuguese (Dolby Digital 5.1), French (Dolby Digital 5.1), English (Dolby Digital 2.0 Surround), Spanish (Dolby Digital 5.1)', 'Studio': 'Universal Pictures Home Entertainment', 'Writers': 'William Davies, Dean DeBlois, Chris Sanders', 'Number of discs': '2'} Review Text: First, this has little to nothing to do with the book of the same title.

Second, this is loads of fun.

Young Hiccup lives in a Viking village routinely raided by dragons (they don't leave because of "stubbornness issues"). He wants to train to fight dragons himself, but he's a skinny little boy, barely suited to the task.

When he finally does get his chance to kill a dragon, he learns very little is what it first seems, and that is true of himself as much as it is true about the dragons.

Thematically, this is about acceptance, and self-acceptance. It's about using one's unique skills to succeed. It's about looking deaper for the truth.

In tone, it's hillarious. One character, on speaking of why they're going to hunt dragons, says "We're vikings. It's an occupational hazzard." It's suited to small children, even sensitive small children. Adults will enjoy it too. Review Title: Great fun for kids and adults Rating: 5.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Product Title: Element: Barre Conditioning Review Date: 2014/02/10 Store: Sadie Lincoln (Actor), Andrea Ambandos (Director) Rated: Unrated Format: DVD Categories: Movies & TV, Genre for Featured Categories, Exercise & Fitness Product Description: ['Grace meets athleticism in these two innovative workouts. Shot in a picturesque garden overlooking the Pacific Ocean, the standing Burn & Firm program is designed to elevate your heart rate as is tones your upper body, lifts your seat, shapes your legs and strengthens your core. It starts with isometric conditioning using small controlled movements and then layers on larger low impact moves designed to build heat with a vigorous flow. This combination will help increase your energy level and sculpt the slim, well-proportioned physique (or silhouette) of a dancer. The Lengthen & Strengthen program is a dynamic combination of standing bare work and floor work focused on tightening and toning very precisely targeted areas to create a balanced body that is long, strong and lean.'] Average Rating: 4.4 Product Details: {'Genre': 'Exercise & fitness - barre method, Exercise & fitness - barre method', 'Format': 'Multiple Formats, Color, NTSC, Widescreen', 'Contributor': 'Sadie Lincoln, Andrea Ambandos', 'Language': 'English', 'Runtime': '1 hour and 9 minutes', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'Unrated (Not Rated)', 'Product Dimensions': '0.7 x 7.5 x 5.4 inches; 2.08 Ounces', 'Audio Description': 'English', 'Item model number': '28125333', 'Director': 'Andrea Ambandos', 'Media Format': 'Multiple Formats, Color, NTSC, Widescreen', 'Run time': '1 hour and 9 minutes', 'Release date': 'December 3, 2013', 'Actors': 'Sadie Lincoln', 'Studio': 'Lionsgate', 'Country of Origin': 'USA', 'Number of discs': '1'} Review Text: There are two workouts on this video. Burn and Firm is focused on conditioning the body through a tightly controlled isometric workout. You won't find complex choreography work here. You won't find "tie yourself in a human knot" type yoga poses. You will find a really solid workout that leaves you feeling it the next day. Each of the workouts automatically adjusts itself to your level as your form improves. Lengthen and Strengthen reminds me of dance class more than yoga. It is focused on improving both flexibility and balance.

These are good for the beginner, as well as those returning to yoga or dance. Review Title: Straightforward and effective workouts Rating: 5.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Review Date: 2015/03/12 Average Rating: 4.8 Product Details: {'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Yoshitomo Yonetani'], 'Producers': ['Kazutaka Akimoto', 'Kôichi Inaba', 'Tokio Inoue', 'Kazumi Kawashiro', 'Muneyuki Kii', 'Joshua Lopez', 'Chika Matsui', 'Yasuo Miyakawa', 'Masayuki Ozaki']} Review Text: I get this was true to the series and the franchise. The voice actors are the same, and great as always.

Tiger is again the underestimated clown who wins more by grit and determination than raw power. Barnaby is still the cool, collected one who has more heart than he shows.

Bison is played the fool a little more in this one, taking a role once reserved for Origami Cyclone, who in turn has shown tremendous growth as a result of the events of the first series. Dragon Kid and Blue Rose are a little underused -- fair enough given it's a movie, with the tune limits that implies. Fire Emblem gets some intense moments. He has a wonderful line, "If a man is made of courage and a woman is made of love, gay people must be invincible." This might have been more impressive if he weren't knocked flat moments later.

I really hope this means they're relaunching the series. This is a strong launch to a new season. Review Title: Loved it Rating: 5.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Review Date: 2015/03/24 Average Rating: 4.7 Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'alcohol use', 'foul language'], 'Audio languages': ['English', 'Español', 'Português'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]', 'Español', 'Português'], 'Directors': ['Jay Oliva'], 'Producers': ['James Tucker'], 'Starring': ['Justin Chambers', 'Justin Chambers', 'Michael Jordan'], 'Studio': ['WARNER HOME VIDEO']} Review Text: It remains shockingly true to the comic despite it being compressed to a movie. This is the story that spawned the New 52, making it a key moment in the DCU history. This storyline is playing heavily into the Flash TV Series on the CW. It's a must for fans of that series, or for comic fans who have not yet read this arc. Those who have will enjoy the retelling. Review Title: Fans of the Flash TV series should see this Rating: 5.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Review Date: 2015/10/23 Average Rating: 4.8 Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'frightening scenes', 'foul language'], 'Audio languages': ['English', 'English [Audio Description]'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Tadayoshi Yamamuro'], 'Producers': ['Norihiro Hayashida', 'Yasushi Ogawa', 'Shinji Shimizu', 'Rioko Tominaga', 'Atsutoshi Umezawa'], 'Starring': ['Hiromi Tsuru', 'Masako Nozawa', 'Ryô Horikawa'], 'Studio': ['FUNimation']} Review Text: This plays with much of the plot from Dragonball Super (which needs to come to the US already!). Frieza is resurrected with the help of the newly upgraded dragon balls of earth (now Shenlong grants two wishes, the second one used is sort of a throwaway, so no reason to introduce it here). He trains. The Z-fighters train. They come together in an exceedingly predictable fight and kick the snot out of each other.

And it is so much fun. Beerus is a trip the entire time. Vegeta is at the top of his form, so much better than the last movie, Goku is that crazy combination of serious and funny that makes him so delightful and Krillian kicks it old school. This is the movie for a grab a beer and shut of the brain night after a hard day of work. This is pure fun, total brain candy, and absolutely worth it. Fans will love it. Review Title: Fun, fluffy but fun Rating: 5.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Product Title: Last, The: Naruto the Movie (BD) Review Date: 2015/10/23 Store: Various (Actor, Director) Rated: Unrated Format: Blu-ray Categories: Movies & TV, Featured Categories, Blu-ray, Anime Product Description: ['Last, The: Naruto the Movie (BD)', "Two years have passed since the fated battle between Naruto and Sasuke in the Village Hidden in the Leaves. A comfortable peace has The Last is the final story of Naruto as you knew him, the hero who was once an outcast, and the first chapter of the bond that will define his future. fallen over the village and the winter festival approaches with a bit more excitement than usual. Seasons of war have transformed Naruto and his friends into elite young warriors, but now they grow into the adults they were meant to be, forming bonds beyond friendship. Naruto and Hinata approach this next stage with trepidation and find their progress stalled when a mysterious and dangerous man appears with a disturbing message: the end of the world is upon them. Once again Naruto and his friends are sent to investigate and stop the impossible, a falling moon! What is the tragic fate that connects this disaster with Hinata's Hyuga Clan? And to what lengths will Naruto go to speak the words that will change his life?", ']]>'] Average Rating: 4.8 Product Details: {'Aspect Ratio': '1.78:1', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'Unrated (Not Rated)', 'Product Dimensions': '0.7 x 7.5 x 5.4 inches; 8.32 Ounces', 'Item model number': '1000536049', 'Director': 'Various', 'Media Format': 'Blu-ray, NTSC', 'Run time': '1 hour and 42 minutes', 'Release date': 'October 6, 2015', 'Actors': 'Various', 'Dubbed': 'English', 'Subtitles': 'English', 'Studio': 'Studio Distribution Services', 'Country of Origin': 'USA', 'Number of discs': '2'} Review Text: Naruto and Hinata sittin' in a tree...

This one is a little silly (ninja escapade on the moon) and a little flighty (there is more talk about knitting in this one movie than in the combined remaining body of ninja anime) and a lot of fun. Naruto is at his best here, and Hinata comes more into her own. This picks up sometime after the end of the series. It is worth it for any Naruto fan. Review Title: Fun Rating: 5.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Product Title: Gatchaman: The Movie Review Date: 2016/06/02 Store: Format: DVD Categories: Movies & TV, Genre for Featured Categories, Anime & Manga Product Description: ["Alien terrorists with giant monsters face off against Japan's greatest super heroes in Gatchaman: The Movie! The Earth is in peril and mankind seems doomed! Led by the sinister mutant Berg Katse, the international terrorist organization known as GALACTOR has launched its armies of henchmen and giant weapons of mass destruction against the entire planet. But the forces of evil are about to meet their match! Utilizing incredible fighting techniques, and with the mighty ship God Phoenix at their command, the Science Ninja Team stands ready to take the battle back to the bad guys and their evil alien overlords! Join Ken the Eagle, Joe the Condor, Jun the Swan, Jinpei the Swallow, and Ryu the Owl, as these five costumed commandos join with their commander, Dr. Nambu, to save our world the old fashioned way: one flying kick at a time! Spoken Languages: English, Japanese, English subtitles."] Average Rating: 4.6 Product Details: {'Genre': 'Anime & Manga', 'Format': 'Multiple Formats, Animated, Color, Subtitled, Widescreen, NTSC', 'Contributor': 'GATCHAMAN: THE MOVIE', 'Language': 'English, Japanese', 'Aspect Ratio': '1.77:1', 'Product Dimensions': '0.7 x 7.5 x 5.4 inches; 2.93 Ounces', 'Item model number': '35223366', 'Media Format': 'Multiple Formats, Animated, Color, Subtitled, Widescreen, NTSC', 'Release date': 'November 17, 2015', 'Subtitles': 'English', 'Studio': 'Section 23', 'Number of discs': '1'} Review Text: It's almost like the entire series in summary form.

If you've seen the original, it's Turtle King, followed by the Van Allen Belt arc, followed by Cross Caronemon. Joe's history is tied together a bit better (so the puppy incident is excluded and the reason for what happens to him at the end ties into the bit with his parents). I'm being intentionally vague so as not to spoil it for folk who haven't seen it.

I've you've seen the original, this is a nice quick run through it all. If not, go see the original. This will feel very rushed otherwise. It's an amazing series that brought in the very first generation of American anime fans. Review Title: Fun for fans of the original Rating: 5.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Product Title: Ghostbusters Review Date: 2016/08/11 Store: Melissa McCarthy (Actor), Kristen Wiig (Actor), Paul Feig (Director) & 0 more Rated: PG-13 Format: Blu-ray Categories: Movies & TV, Blu-ray, Movies Product Description: ['Ghostbusters makes its long-awaited return with Director Paul Feig\'s unique and hilarious take on the classic, supernatural comedy, led by the freshest minds in comedy today, Melissa McCarthy, Kristen Wiig, Kate McKinnon, Leslie Jones, and Chris Hemsworth. Together they team-up to save Manhattan from a sudden invasion of spirits, spooks and slime that engulfs the city. Robert Abele of TheWrap says, "This new A-team of ghostbusters are fresh and funny."'] Average Rating: 4.5 Product Details: {'Digital Copy Expiration Date': 'June 28, 2019', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'PG-13 (Parents Strongly Cautioned)', 'Product Dimensions': '0.7 x 7.5 x 5.4 inches; 10.72 Ounces', 'Audio Description': 'English', 'Item model number': '43213194', 'Director': 'Paul Feig', 'Media Format': '4K', 'Run time': '6 hours and 6 minutes', 'Release date': 'October 11, 2016', 'Actors': 'Melissa McCarthy, Kristen Wiig, Leslie Jones, Chris Hemsworth, Cecily Strong', 'Dubbed': 'Thai, French, Spanish', 'Subtitles': 'Thai, Mandarin Chinese, Indonesian, Korean, English, French, Spanish, Vietnamese, Cantonese', 'Producers': 'Amy Pascal, Ivan Reitman', 'Studio': 'Sony Pictures Home Entertainment', 'Country of Origin': 'USA', 'Number of discs': '3'} Review Text: This was a brilliant reboot, with a fabulous story of its own and a great tribute to the original, from the small (the Stay Puff Marshmallow Man makes a cameo) to the large (Bill Murray plays a delightful, larger than cameo role).

What to like about the movie:
The 3D was amazing. At one point everyone jumped. It was great.
The plot was delightful.
The humor was on point, with most of the audience laughing aloud. At one point a random taxi driver drops the "I ain't afraid of no ghost" line.
The allusions to the original fit naturally and flowed perfectly.
The acting was fantastic.
Chris Helmsworth. I'll watch him in just about anything.

What's not to like:
There are women doing what men used to do, and that's scary. Review Title: Really good movie Rating: 5.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Review Date: 2023/03/12 Average Rating: 4.5 Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'foul language'], 'Audio languages': ['English', 'English [Audio Description]'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Aneesh Chaganty'], 'Producers': ['Timur Bekmambetov', 'Sev Ohanian', 'Natalie Qasabian', 'Adam Sidman'], 'Starring': ['John Cho', 'Debra Messing', 'Joseph Lee'], 'Studio': ['Screen Gems']} Review Text: If you liked Missing, you’ll love this, and of course if you like this, you’ll love Missing. They follow the same patterns of searching for clues online and nothing is what it seems. They are both the kind of movie you watch twice in a row, once to experience the story, the second time with the benefit of hindsight to see the clues for what they really are. There are a few that should have been clearly false, based on other information that came earlier (a thing related to her allowance, it will make sense at the time).

At its most basic, this is the story of a girl who’s gone missing. Her father and the police try to find her, and her dad tries to follow the digital trail. All mysteries have a good supply of red herrings, but these are so perfect, so misinterpreted and re-misinterpreted and so organic to the story it’s masterful.

Stylistically, I liked the grainy SD segments where we’re watching the events through an in-story low-grade camera. It was both more immersive (it should have looked like that) and yet it called attention to itself because SD is so far in our collective rear view.

As we dig deeper into the story, no one and nothing is what it first seems. The narrative style is such that only a little information comes through at a time and it keeps the viewer delightfully off balance the entire time. The most insignificant details mean so much at the end.

It hits some beautiful points with social media where everyone is wearing a mask, either to get attention or to hide an ugly soul behind, and in one case to capitalize on the father’s tragedy. It hits some beautiful points as well. Emotionally, this is a roller coaster.

Watch this with friends who are game to pause the video and check the details on the screen. There is so much that flies right by. It’s brilliant.

The only thing I don’t like, is that so many details happen visually, and this movie requires such close attention, it’s a poor choice to watch while knitting. Review Title: A masterpiece in writing and execution Rating: 5.0 --------------------------------------------------

Really good movie {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'foul language'], 'Audio languages': ['English', 'English [Audio Description]'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Aneesh Chaganty'], 'Producers': ['Timur Bekmambetov', 'Sev Ohanian', 'Natalie Qasabian', 'Adam Sidman'], 'Starring': ['John Cho', 'Debra Messing', 'Joseph Lee'], 'Studio': ['Screen Gems']} If you liked Missing, you’ll love this, and of course if you like this, you’ll love Missing. They follow the same patterns of searching for clues online and nothing is what it seems. They are both the kind of movie you watch twice in a row, once to experience the story, the second time with the benefit of hindsight to see the clues for what they really are. There are a few that should have been clearly false, based on other information that came earlier (a thing related to her allowance, it will make sense at the time).

At its most basic, this is the story of a girl who’s gone missing. Her father and the police try to find her, and her dad tries to follow the digital trail. All mysteries have a good supply of red herrings, but these are so perfect, so misinterpreted and re-misinterpreted and so organic to the story it’s masterful.

Stylistically, I liked the grainy SD segments where we’re watching the events through an in-story low-grade camera. It was both more immersive (it should have looked like that) and yet it called attention to itself because SD is so far in our collective rear view.

As we dig deeper into the story, no one and nothing is what it first seems. The narrative style is such that only a little information comes through at a time and it keeps the viewer delightfully off balance the entire time. The most insignificant details mean so much at the end.

It hits some beautiful points with social media where everyone is wearing a mask, either to get attention or to hide an ugly soul behind, and in one case to capitalize on the father’s tragedy. It hits some beautiful points as well. Emotionally, this is a roller coaster.

Watch this with friends who are game to pause the video and check the details on the screen. There is so much that flies right by. It’s brilliant.

The only thing I don’t like, is that so many details happen visually, and this movie requires such close attention, it’s a poor choice to watch while knitting. A masterpiece in writing and execution

The Lengthen & Strengthen program is a dynamic combination of standing bare work and floor work focused on tightening and toning very precisely targeted areas to create a balanced body that is long, strong and lean.'] Average Rating: 4.4 Product Details: {'Genre': 'Exercise & fitness - barre method, Exercise & fitness - barre method', 'Format': 'Multiple Formats, Color, NTSC, Widescreen', 'Contributor': 'Sadie Lincoln, Andrea Ambandos', 'Language': 'English', 'Runtime': '1 hour and 9 minutes', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'Unrated (Not Rated)', 'Product Dimensions': '0.7 x 7.5 x 5.4 inches; 2.08 Ounces', 'Audio Description': 'English', 'Item model number': '28125333', 'Director': 'Andrea Ambandos', 'Media Format': 'Multiple Formats, Color, NTSC, Widescreen', 'Run time': '1 hour and 9 minutes', 'Release date': 'December 3, 2013', 'Actors': 'Sadie Lincoln', 'Studio': 'Lionsgate', 'Country of Origin': 'USA', 'Number of discs': '1'} Review Text: There are two workouts on this video. Burn and Firm is focused on conditioning the body through a tightly controlled isometric workout. You won't find complex choreography work here. You won't find "tie yourself in a human knot" type yoga poses. You will find a really solid workout that leaves you feeling it the next day. Each of the workouts automatically adjusts itself to your level as your form improves. Lengthen and Strengthen reminds me of dance class more than yoga. It is focused on improving both flexibility and balance.

These are good for the beginner, as well as those returning to yoga or dance. Review Title: Straightforward and effective workouts Rating: 5.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Review Date: 2015/03/12 Average Rating: 4.8 Product Details: {'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Yoshitomo Yonetani'], 'Producers': ['Kazutaka Akimoto', 'Kôichi Inaba', 'Tokio Inoue', 'Kazumi Kawashiro', 'Muneyuki Kii', 'Joshua Lopez', 'Chika Matsui', 'Yasuo Miyakawa', 'Masayuki Ozaki']} Review Text: I get this was true to the series and the franchise. The voice actors are the same, and great as always.

Tiger is again the underestimated clown who wins more by grit and determination than raw power. Barnaby is still the cool, collected one who has more heart than he shows.

Bison is played the fool a little more in this one, taking a role once reserved for Origami Cyclone, who in turn has shown tremendous growth as a result of the events of the first series. Dragon Kid and Blue Rose are a little underused -- fair enough given it's a movie, with the tune limits that implies. Fire Emblem gets some intense moments. He has a wonderful line, "If a man is made of courage and a woman is made of love, gay people must be invincible." This might have been more impressive if he weren't knocked flat moments later.

I really hope this means they're relaunching the series. This is a strong launch to a new season. Review Title: Loved it Rating: 5.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Review Date: 2015/03/24 Average Rating: 4.7 Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'alcohol use', 'foul language'], 'Audio languages': ['English', 'Español', 'Português'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]', 'Español', 'Português'], 'Directors': ['Jay Oliva'], 'Producers': ['James Tucker'], 'Starring': ['Justin Chambers', 'Justin Chambers', 'Michael Jordan'], 'Studio': ['WARNER HOME VIDEO']} Review Text: It remains shockingly true to the comic despite it being compressed to a movie. This is the story that spawned the New 52, making it a key moment in the DCU history. This storyline is playing heavily into the Flash TV Series on the CW. It's a must for fans of that series, or for comic fans who have not yet read this arc. Those who have will enjoy the retelling. Review Title: Fans of the Flash TV series should see this Rating: 5.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Review Date: 2015/10/23 Average Rating: 4.8 Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'frightening scenes', 'foul language'], 'Audio languages': ['English', 'English [Audio Description]'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Tadayoshi Yamamuro'], 'Producers': ['Norihiro Hayashida', 'Yasushi Ogawa', 'Shinji Shimizu', 'Rioko Tominaga', 'Atsutoshi Umezawa'], 'Starring': ['Hiromi Tsuru', 'Masako Nozawa', 'Ryô Horikawa'], 'Studio': ['FUNimation']} Review Text: This plays with much of the plot from Dragonball Super (which needs to come to the US already!). Frieza is resurrected with the help of the newly upgraded dragon balls of earth (now Shenlong grants two wishes, the second one used is sort of a throwaway, so no reason to introduce it here). He trains. The Z-fighters train. They come together in an exceedingly predictable fight and kick the snot out of each other.

And it is so much fun. Beerus is a trip the entire time. Vegeta is at the top of his form, so much better than the last movie, Goku is that crazy combination of serious and funny that makes him so delightful and Krillian kicks it old school. This is the movie for a grab a beer and shut of the brain night after a hard day of work. This is pure fun, total brain candy, and absolutely worth it. Fans will love it. Robert Abele of TheWrap says, "This new A-team of ghostbusters are fresh and funny."'] Average Rating: 4.5 Product Details: {'Digital Copy Expiration Date': 'June 28, 2019', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'PG-13 (Parents Strongly Cautioned)', 'Product Dimensions': '0.7 x 7.5 x 5.4 inches; 10.72 Ounces', 'Audio Description': 'English', 'Item model number': '43213194', 'Director': 'Paul Feig', 'Media Format': '4K', 'Run time': '6 hours and 6 minutes', 'Release date': 'October 11, 2016', 'Actors': 'Melissa McCarthy, Kristen Wiig, Leslie Jones, Chris Hemsworth, Cecily Strong', 'Dubbed': 'Thai, French, Spanish', 'Subtitles': 'Thai, Mandarin Chinese, Indonesian, Korean, English, French, Spanish, Vietnamese, Cantonese', 'Producers': 'Amy Pascal, Ivan Reitman', 'Studio': 'Sony Pictures Home Entertainment', 'Country of Origin': 'USA', 'Number of discs': '3'} Review Text: This was a brilliant reboot, with a fabulous story of its own and a great tribute to the original, from the small (the Stay Puff Marshmallow Man makes a cameo) to the large (Bill Murray plays a delightful, larger than cameo role).

What to like about the movie:
The 3D was amazing. At one point everyone jumped. It was great.
The plot was delightful.
The humor was on point, with most of the audience laughing aloud. At one point a random taxi driver drops the "I ain't afraid of no ghost" line.
The allusions to the original fit naturally and flowed perfectly.
The acting was fantastic.
Chris Helmsworth. I'll watch him in just about anything.

What's not to like:
There are women doing what men used to do, and that's scary. Review Title: Really good movie Rating: 5.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Review Date: 2023/03/12 Average Rating: 4.5 Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'foul language'], 'Audio languages': ['English', 'English [Audio Description]'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Aneesh Chaganty'], 'Producers': ['Timur Bekmambetov', 'Sev Ohanian', 'Natalie Qasabian', 'Adam Sidman'], 'Starring': ['John Cho', 'Debra Messing', 'Joseph Lee'], 'Studio': ['Screen Gems']} Review Text: If you liked Missing, you’ll love this, and of course if you like this, you’ll love Missing. They follow the same patterns of searching for clues online and nothing is what it seems. They are both the kind of movie you watch twice in a row, once to experience the story, the second time with the benefit of hindsight to see the clues for what they really are. There are a few that should have been clearly false, based on other information that came earlier (a thing related to her allowance, it will make sense at the time).

At its most basic, this is the story of a girl who’s gone missing. Her father and the police try to find her, and her dad tries to follow the digital trail. All mysteries have a good supply of red herrings, but these are so perfect, so misinterpreted and re-misinterpreted and so organic to the story it’s masterful.

Stylistically, I liked the grainy SD segments where we’re watching the events through an in-story low-grade camera. It was both more immersive (it should have looked like that) and yet it called attention to itself because SD is so far in our collective rear view.

As we dig deeper into the story, no one and nothing is what it first seems. The narrative style is such that only a little information comes through at a time and it keeps the viewer delightfully off balance the entire time. The most insignificant details mean so much at the end.

It hits some beautiful points with social media where everyone is wearing a mask, either to get attention or to hide an ugly soul behind, and in one case to capitalize on the father’s tragedy. It hits some beautiful points as well. Emotionally, this is a roller coaster.

Watch this with friends who are game to pause the video and check the details on the screen. There is so much that flies right by. It’s brilliant.

The only thing I don’t like, is that so many details happen visually, and this movie requires such close attention, it’s a poor choice to watch while knitting. target_interaction.title: Fun for fans of the classic show and of the new adaptations
target_interaction.text:
This is pure fun.

In the opening, this cranks up the ridiculous past anywhere it was in the original cartoon. Before the opening credits roll Shaggy locks a door with four or five locks, then opens a door across the way, sees a monster, turns and tries to pull the door he just locked open without unlocking it. Then he turns to the left and runs out an open archway into the hallway. That entire opening sequence, aside from being hilarious, sets up the “monsters are always fake” pathway.

We move to Daphne in her modern world on a television interview talking about changing her career to a reporter for a show called “Coast to Coast with Daphne Blake” and get all the needed backstory on how the team split up, sans her and Fred (and, one presumes, Shaggy and Scooby), how she got bored with all the monsters and ghosts always being fake (ruh roh, foreshadowing) and what tone we might expect from the rest of the movie. From there it’s the traditional “get the gang back together and let’s go solve a mystery” motif. This sets up the “this time the monsters are real” pathway.

The movie could follow either path. I’m not saying which it does.

This appeals on multiple fronts. First, for fans of the original wanting more of what they fell in love with, the antics (some dive right into Loony Toons territory) the goofy traps, the dynamic of the team, this has it. At its core, that’s what this is (whacky chase scenes to music and all).

Fans of the newer versions who like the more take a step back look at their world and their place in it, there is plenty of that here, particularly in the music (The Ghost is Here) and the jokes (stale Scooby Snax – that is how it’s spelled on the box). At one point Shaggy unpacks a suitcase filled with identical green shirts. The two elements balance and compliment each other quite well.

For an old movie, this still holds up. The video is great for a cartoon, even if in a square, not wide-screen format because of its age, and the sound quality, while stereo not surround sound, is excellent. If you’re going to watch the 2019 Return to Zombie Island, it’s definitely worth watching this first as that is a direct sequel to this.
